column2: WEST VIRGINIA DMV TEST
column6: WV

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: rideplaning.
column8: pavement-planing.

column2: 2. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: delay near it.
column10: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 3. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: look and listen for trains.
column8: wait until the crossing gates are completely up.

column2: 4. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 5. You are approaching an intersection when the signal turns yellow. You should:
column4: stop then enter the intersection when safe to do so.
column6: speed up to get through the intersection before the red light comes on.
column8: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Steep downgrade
column8: Narrow Bridge

column2: 7. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the right may pass.
column8: the lane to the left may pass.
column10: passing is not permitted in either direction.

column2: 8. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column6: parallel to the curb.
column8: in any direction.

column2: 9. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use only one hand on the wheel.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 10. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 11. This warning sign:
column4: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column6: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow
column8: No right turn

column2: 14. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column6: look for a detour or another route.
column8: remove the sign and move forward.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 15. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a winding road.
column8: merging traffic.
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 16. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.
column8: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.

column2: 17. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column6: Tranquilizers.
column8: A cold remedy.

column2: 18. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in the direction you want to go.
column6: to keep the front wheels straight.
column8: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column10: in the opposite direction of the skid.

column2: 19. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Rely on your mirrors.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing ahead
column8: Pedestrians must not cross

column2: 21. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
column6: high beam headlights.
column8: low beam headlights.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: All traffic turn right
column8: Low clearance

column2: 23. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 24. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 25. Before backing up, you should:
column4: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column6: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column8: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
